body: This is us moving to the new faster hashing library, stick with an older version on that device for now.
Yeah, unfortunately I'm fairly unsurprised by this. :/

It killed 4 of my systems (Odroid-C2) so I was very surprised. I have been looking forward to the hashing improvements so it's worth a little pain.

I rolled back to 0.14.6 by copying syncthing.old and turned of auto upgrades (<autoUpgradeIntervalH>0</autoUpgradeIntervalH> for anyone editing their config.xml).

Looking forward to 0.14.8. Let me know if you need someone to test the ARM64 version.

issue.title: Illegal instruction crash on ARM64

repository.name: sha256-simd
repository.description: Accelerate SHA256 computations in pure Go using  AVX512, SHA Extensions for x86 and ARM64 for ARM. On AVX512 it provides an up to 8x improvement (over 3 GB/s per core). SHA Extensions give a performance boost of close to 4x over native.

issue.body:
It seems that `Amlogic ARM® Cortex®-A53(ARMv8) 1.5Ghz` CPUs are misdetected somehow, causing a SIGILL on these systems. The crashing instruction is [here](https://github.com/minio/sha256-simd/blob/master/sha256block_arm64.s#L59). I don't have one of these myself, but can probably extract relevant info if you suggest what's needed and how to get it. :)

(Relates to https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/3613)

rename.from: Upgrade from 14.6 to 14.7 causes syncthing to crash on Arm64

body:
Filed upstream. Luckily this should be fairly limited impact as we've currently got around 0.05% of the population on arm64, and hopefully not all of those on this specific CPU. Not to sat that the impact to those of you who have this CPU isn't bad, just that there aren't that many of you. :)

Does the arm (32 bit) version run on these systems?
I'll upload 14.7 on Debian with `crypto/sha256` instead.
Be sure to note that in your release notes, as you're removing an improvement for the vast majority that is mentioned in our release notes.

issue.title: v0.14.7 huge hash performance degradation

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
v0.14.6 reports this:

```
23:36:13 INFO: syncthing v0.14.6 "Dysprosium Dragonfly" (go1.7 linux-amd64) builduser@svetlemodry 2016-09-06 15:26:27 UTC
23:36:13 INFO: Single thread hash performance is ~186 MB/s
```

 v0.14.7 consistently reports:

```
23:35:03 INFO: syncthing v0.14.7 "Dysprosium Dragonfly" (go1.7.1 linux-amd64) builduser@svetlemodry 2016-09-21 18:31:42 UTC
23:35:03 INFO: Single thread hash performance is ~43 MB/s
```

I've tried to restart it few times and every time it was around ~40MB/s

OS: Archlinux

issue.title: Evaluate minio/sha256-simd implementation
issue.body:
The guys from @minio developed an optimized version of the sha256 hash, which is heavily used within restic: https://github.com/minio/sha256-simd

Evaluate the performance gains in comparison to stock `crypto/sha256`.

body:
I'm also having those troubles on a Odroid C2 (Syncthing v0.14.10).
Running Arch Linux (Linux hostname 3.14.79-11-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Nov 3 19:23:19 MDT 2016 aarch64 GNU/Linux)
As a workaround you need to start it manually by running the `syncthing` command as the specific user you want it to run with.
Fails hard via `systemctl start syncthing@[username].service` and won't regenerate.

The following will happen via issuing the command `syncthing` but it runs afterwards anyways:

```
SIGILL: illegal instruction
[monitor] 11:59:22 WARNING: 
*******************************************************************************
* Crash due to illegal instruction detected. This is most likely due to a CPU *
* incompatibility with the high performance hashing package. Switching to the *
* standard hashing package instead. Please report this issue at:              *
*                                                                             *
*   https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues                             *
*                                                                             *
* Include the details of your CPU.                                            *
*******************************************************************************

[monitor] 11:59:22 INFO: Syncthing exited: exit status 2
[monitor] 11:59:23 INFO: Starting syncthing
[AZEB3] 11:59:23 INFO: syncthing v0.14.10 "Dysprosium Dragonfly" (go1.7.3 linux-arm64) builduser@leming 2016-11-02 01:30:49 UTC
```

EDIT (2017-01-02): 
Fails still hard, even with v0.14.18

Edit (2017-02-11):
FINALLY working with >= v0.14.23. Happend to run on a broken down microSD aswell - but this was not the problem.
(Also but totally unrelated: Beware - Some common packages for AArch64 Arch Linux do not seem to be maintained well..)
